Attachment I Audit Roport No. A-1711
(B) Motor vehicles and Parts:
(1) Government enterprises
a. Taiwan Highway Bureau b. City Bus Companies
(2) Private passenger and trucking service
(c) Machinery:
(1) Various government enterprises
(2) Private industrios
(D) General Equipment and Commodities:
(1) Government trading agencies for rationing to civil servants
(2) Open auction to light industries
Furthermore, the resale of excess property is prohibited unless prior concurrence of CUSA and US AID/C is obtained on a case by case basis.
2. Allocation of non-project excess property: After issuance of purchase order, a "List of U.S. Government-owned Domestic Excess Property" is compiled by CUSA 3D and distributed to various government enterprises. The allocations are requested by letters. Upon arrival of the shipment, com- modities are stored in TSB warehouse from where the ap- proved recipients tako delivery of the itoms they required. Review of the documents revealed that the allocations were made generally in compliance with the order of priority with an exception that a number of machinery items were allocated to the military agencies, such as 44th Arsenal, 61st Arsenal and Production Service Office of the Combined Service Forces (PSO/CSF). The military utilization of excess property procured under economic aid financing is definitely not appropriate as mentioned in the PO letter of 2/20/62. It was stated by Mr. S. Y. Tan of CUSA/3D that such machinery have not yet been delivered to military agencios and that CUSA has verbally advised the recipients of the cancellation of allocation, as instructed by PO.
3. Auction of excess property: Excess properties are sold through auction to the successful bidders by each commodity category mentioned in Section C-1. Review of the documents disclosed that some items procured under PA 0220 & 1206 were sold to tradors. They are listed below:
